[[Egypt]] is a [[Semi-presidential system|Semi-presidential]] [[republic]] under [[State of emergency|Emergency Law]] (Law No. 162 of 1958)<ref>[http://www.emerglobal.com/lex/law-1958-162 Law 1958/162 (Emergency Law)] {{ar}} at [http://emerglobal.com/lex EMERglobal Lex], part of the [[Edinburgh Middle East Report]]. Retrieved 2010-04-02.</ref> since 1967, except for an 18-month break in 1980. President Hosni Mubarak had ruled Egypt since 1981.
  +   +
== Early protests ==
In Egypt, at least six cases of self-immolation have been reported, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown Cairo<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=David Rosenberg|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|publisher=The Media Line|date=2011-01-24 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref>
In Egypt, at least six cases of self-immolation have been reported, including a man arrested while trying to set himself on fire in downtown Cairo<ref name="Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast">{{cite web|author=David Rosenberg|url=http://www.themedialine.org/news/news_detail.asp?NewsID=31194|title=Self-Immolation Spreads Across the Mideast, Inspiring Protest, Controversy|publisher=The Media Line|date=2011-01-24 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref>
  +   +
=== Rising elites' support and continuing protests ===
Thousands were protesting in the capital of [[Cairo]] on the ''25th of January''<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt">{{cite web|author=Amir Ahmed|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/25/egypt.protests/|title=Thousands protests in Egypt|publisher=CNN|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. 200 demonstrators were in the southern city of [[Aswan]], 2000 in the eastern city of [[Ismailiya]]; and about 3000 in the northern city of [[Mahallah]]<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt"/>.
Thousands were protesting in the capital of [[Cairo]] on the ''25th of January''<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt">{{cite web|author=Amir Ahmed|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/25/egypt.protests/|title=Thousands protests in Egypt|publisher=CNN|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. 200 demonstrators were in the southern city of [[Aswan]], 2000 in the eastern city of [[Ismailiya]]; and about 3000 in the northern city of [[Mahallah]]<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt"/>.
